articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: 'Mass shooting' at California bar
articles.description: Police respond to mass shooting at bar in Thousand Oaks, California

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: US Supreme Court judge fractures ribs
articles.description: Ruth Bader Ginsburg, 85, suffered three rib fractures in a fall, a court spokeswoman says.

articles.title: Russia probe under threat, Democrats say
articles.description: Donald Trump's opponents raise fears over the inquiry after he fired his attorney general.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Warship collides with tanker in fjord
articles.description: Norway evacuates a frigate after it collides with a tanker, leaving seven people lightly injured.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Man wins three lottery prizes in one day
articles.description: A New Jersey man wins three in a row on scratch cards including the top prize.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Pakistan frees Christian woman Asia Bibi
articles.description: Asia Bibi's lawyer tells AFP that she is "on a plane" to an unknown destination.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Dutchman, 69, sues to lower his age
articles.description: Emile Ratelband wants to officially change his birth date by 20 years to boost his Tinder prospects.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Which of these newsreaders isn't real?
articles.description: China's Xinhua news agency says it has developed an artificial intelligence newsreader.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Hundreds of buffaloes drown 'fleeing lions'
articles.description: Some think the buffaloes were running away from lions when they got stuck in the Chobe River.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: White House suspends CNN reporter's access
articles.description: Jim Acosta was called a "terrible person" by President Trump after he refused to stop asking questions.
